values.summary:
Provides C++ Mentoring, Agile Coaching and Consulting.
Contact via glen.ritschel@gmail.com


====  C++ Mentor  ====
I read and recommend the following books:
* Effective C++ by Scott Meyers
* More Effective C++ by Scott Meyers
* Effective STL by Scott Meyers
* C++ Coding Standards by Herb Sutter and Andrei Alexandrescu
* Exceptional C++ Style by Herb Sutter and Andrei Alexandrescu
* Exceptional C++ by Herb Sutter
* More Exceptional C++ by Herb Sutter
* Modern C++ Design by A. Alexandrescu
* Inside the C++ Object Model by Stanley B. Lippman
* Large-Scale C++ Development by John Lakos
* The C++ Standard Library by Nicolai M. Josuttis
* C++ Templates by David Vandevoord and Nicolai M. Josuttis

====  Agile Coaching  ====
I read and recommend the following books:
* Continuous Delivery by Jez Humble and David Farley
* Agile Project Management with Scrum by Ken Schwaber
* Extreme Programming Explained by Kent Beck
* Extreme Programming Installed by Ron Jeffries et al.
* Planning Extreme Programming by Kent Beck and Martin J. Fowler
* Growing Object-Oriented Software, Guided by Tests by Steve Freeman and Nat Pryce
* Jenkins: The Definitive Guide by John Ferguson Smart
* Agile Testing by Lisa Crispin and Janet Gregory
* Refactoring Databases by Scott W. Ambler and Pramod J. Sadalage
* Refactoring to Patterns by Joshua Kerievsky
* Writing Effective Use Cases by Alistair Cockburn
* Release It! by Michael T. Nygard
* Managing Agile Projects by S. Augustine
* User Stories Applied by Mike Cohen
* Leading Lean Software Development by M. and T. Poppendieck
values.title: C++ Mentor, Agile Coach and Consultant

summary:
I have a lot of experience in Large-Scale C and C++ Software Development. 

I have been involved with most major kinds of software development methodologies and practices: Structured Programming, Object-Oriented Programming, Waterfall, Iterative, Extreme Programming, Scrum, Test-Driven Design and Cowboy Programming.

I have written and debugged Machine Code, Assembly Language, FORTRAN (11 years), Fortran (they changed the name), Pascal, Ada (5 years), C (7 years), C++ (6 years), and Perl (3 years).

I have a lot of expertise in developing multi-threaded software.

I have done driver work on both Linux and Windows, including getting Microsoft WHCL certification on a set of drivers (not a small feat).

I have developed Real-Time firmware.

I like creating software that is used (as opposed to shelf-ware or cancelled projects). For example, I have written software that is flying in F-15, Tornado, and other fighter jets.  I have written software that has flown in E-3A, and A-10.  The A-10 was a demo, but it was highly rewarding, because it was tested with real A-10 pilots, and I was involved from the beginning to the end with pilot interviews.

Software that I wrote is shipped with Dialogic Telecom Boards, and Host Media Processing.  I have been involved with the re-architecting of the Bloomberg MSG Backend, that had to replace the legacy architecture in real-time. (Steve Weinrich was the main architect).

I have done some Java, a lot of Perl.

The rest of the technologies listed in the Specialties sections are what I am striving to learn. I typically read one or two books on the technology while playing with it.

Debuggers: gdb, dbx, windbg, Purify, Quantify, MSVS and others.

I recently created a mentoring network at Dialogic, where individuals mentor each other for 10 minutes.. I am currently mentoring 9 people per month and being mentored by 9 people per month.

I have also been a manager of several projects providing value to business.

•	Worked on all facets of massive community LIA application including: database and DAO integration, middle layer logic like Viewers and Domain Object managers, Tapestry framework component page rendering with quilts, AJAX event handling, and front end scripting with combinations of JavaScript/jQuery/HTML5/CSS. summary:
•	Over seven years of industry Java software development experience, including professional experience with server-side development using J2EE, Web Services, JDBC, and numerous other tools, frameworks, and languages.
•	Solid understanding and experience with front-end technologies such as JavaScript, CSS3, HTML5, and AJAX.
•	Experience with team management and project ownership (owned Lithosphere Community for iPhone native iPhone application at Lithium Technologies Inc., owned NASCAR Web Service project at Hands-On Mobile/Sprint, managed Dolegate iPhone application team of four, owned Williams-Sonoma Saved Credit Card Web Service project, and owned eHealth iPhone application project)
•	Full knowledge of structural detail and rich experience of technological implementation of the full Web Service Request flow from Client to Server including: using JavaScript XHR, making Web Service REST calls, request servlet dispatching, and persistence frameworks. 
•	Extensive knowledge of Spring MVC 3.0 framework including: MVC beans, interceptors, OXM bindings, JDBC, Hibernate
•	Extensive knowledge of Tapestry framework including: contributed components, quilts, and services.
•	Over two years of industry experience with iPhone application development using Objective C and XCode 4 (Lithium Technologies Inc., Dolegate, eHealth)
•	Experience with all aspects of project life cycle including: design, documentation, development, load testing, quality assurance, deployment, management, and maintenance.
•	Solid hands-on J2EE application server experience with Tomcat and JBoss
•	Strong experience with relational databases such as MySQL; experience with Protobuf storage
•	Strong experience with E-Commerce development and deployment/implementation of large-scale enterprise applications
•	Solid Swing and AWT experience using Java across different platforms
•	Mobile game design experience using J2ME, with concepts such as collision detection, physics, and sprite animation
